concept.title: What is CAT software and what is it used for?

conbody.p: Computer-aided translation (CAT) means the use of software to assist a human translator in the translation process. A human creates the translation, and software only facilitates certain aspects of the process.
CAT does not mean machine translation (MT), where a computer creates the translation.
CAT software is an excellent tool for translating and localizing technical documentation. They also make it easy to manage terminology and content simultaneously in many different languages.
CAT programs typically are the tools that specifically facilitate the actual translation process. Most CAT tools provide:

ul.li: The ability to translate a variety of source file formats in a single editing environment,
Integration of various utilities or processes that increase productivity and consistency in translation.
